page.title: 14Ires Geo
page.content: Most of the cliffs are of Mid.Dev. Old Red Sandstone with Caithness flagstone outcrops: below 50m. in height and cut into Geos,Stacks or Caves.Ires Geo has flat rocks at the base and provides access for seals.It is part of an S.S.S.I.stretching from Craig Hammel to Skeps Geo and noted for its colonies of seabirds:-Puffins,Herring gulls,Cormorants,Fulmars,Guillemots, Kittiwakes and Shags. Cliff top vegetation includes Fescues, Cotton grass,Crowberry,Hawk weed,Thyme Yorkshire fog and Purple moor grass. Away from the cliff edge the veg. grades into blanket bog and heath with patches of distinctive northern species including the Primula Scotica. There are the remains of ruined croft houses and old peat cuttings on the cliff top.Access to the sea is by the steep grassy slopes of the geo.
